intro: Uvaria acrantha, commonly known as the horned uvaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and simple, opposite leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Uvaria acrantha produces small, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine.
